content.description: Southern Cross was bolted during a bouldering trip with Evan Marsh in the early fall of 2007. The overhanging limestone faces south and catches the sun afternoon and early evening. This climb starts on overhanging limestone pockets then heads out and over a roof bulge to a steep upper face. I used a pink .05 tricam for extra protection in one of the roof pockets during the first ascent. A two bolt rap anchor available for a clean rappel.
content.protection: Quick draws, pink .05 tricam, and standard rap anchor cleaning gear.
content.location: Head down the water drainage, south and down hill from the Throne. An old forest road and faint game trail gets you close to the creek. The creek then cuts through the sandstone and down through the limestone to form a seasonal waterfall. Down climb the shoot which brings you to an undercut ledge area. Southern Cross starts on the right wall, on the left side of the overhang. Do not walk down to the lower section or you have gone too far. Top rope is possible off trees above but are located on a very steep slope.

content.description: Overhanging limestone, directly down hill, south of the Throne, between White Trash Wall and the Deliverance ridge. Several lines established, including a mixed route called Southern Cross. This is a sport line that I suggest using a 0.5 pink tricam between two of the bolts.The Southern Cross wall is currently listed under Sam's Throne, as it is part of the hill side that is just below the Throne. I have listed the area here until a determination is made on how and where to list the area.
